content:
I hadn't been on my Garuda arch system in a while and I got the following:

ERROR: Unable to load dependent library (homedir)/.julia/juliaup/julia-1.11.3+0.x64.linux.gnu/bin/../lib/julia/libopenlibm.so
Message: (homedir)//.julia/juliaup/julia-1.11.3+0.x64.linux.gnu/bin/../lib/julia/libopenlibm.so: cannot enable executable stack as shared object requires: Invalid argument

wiped .julia and fresh juliaup install - same thing.

Mint and Mac systems are fine.

I ended up doing the package manger version
sudo pacman -Syu julia
but Franklin won't install and CUDA barks at me that I'm using an unsupported version of Julia.

In all fairness the system glitched after update a while back so it may be specific to the box, but I'd rather not do a wipe and start over.
John Wise has marked this topic as resolved.
